dev.aherscu.qa.jgiven.commons.utils

Class StageEx<SELF extends StageEx<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tngtech.jgiven.base.StageBase<SELF>
      • com.tngtech.jgiven.Stage<SELF>
        • dev.aherscu.qa.jgiven.commons.utils.StageEx<SELF>
  • Type Parameters:
    SELF - the type of the extending class to realize the fluent interface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericActions, GenericFixtures, GenericVerifications

    public class StageEx<SELF extends StageEx<?>>
extends com.tngtech.jgiven.Stage<SELF>
    Provides a reference to current step in order to allow attachments.
    Author:
    aherscu

    • Field Detail

      • ATTACHEMENT_TRANSFORMER

        public static final UnaryOperator<ImageUtils.Pipeline> ATTACHEMENT_TRANSFORMER
        Override to force other image transformation.

        NOTE: Defaults to a grayed palette. Scaling down here, may lead to unreadable thumbnails in the generated JGiven report. See https://github.com/TNG/JGiven/issues/417

      • attach

        protected String attach(String text)
        Attaches specified text. Useful for attaching JSON, XML, or just plain text. Override to customize, e.g. to shorten or format the text.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to attach
        Returns:
        the attached text

      • configurePolling

        @BeforeScenario
protected void configurePolling()
        Configures the retry policy. Configurable via:
        • poll.delay -- defaults to 1 second
        • poll.timeout -- defaults to 10 seconds

        IMPORTANT: if you override this method, you should ensure that other policy properties are setup properly, either by calling this implementation via super.configureRetryPolicy(), or by other means.

      • context

        protected SELF context(Predicate<String> byRule,
                       org.openqa.selenium.ContextAware ca)
        Switches to specified Appium context.
        Parameters:
        byRule - naming rule of Appium context
        ca - a context aware driver, usually a mobile driver
        Returns:
        StageBase.self()
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchContextException - if no such context exists

      • element

        protected final org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                                                       org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext context)
        Retrieves a DOM element by specified locator and context and brings it into view, if needed. If the locator is matching multiple elements then the first one is returned.

        locateTimer metric will be updated including the scrolling into view, if needed.

        Parameters:
        locator - the locator
        context - the context
        Returns:
        the DOM element
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException - if the element does not exist

      • elements

        protected final List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> elements(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                                                              org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext context)
        Retrieves DOM elements by specified locator and context. If the locator is matching multiple elements then the first one is returned.

        locateTimer metric will be updated.

        Parameters:
        locator - the locator
        context - the context
        Returns:
        list of DOM elements

      • ensureElements

        protected final List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> ensureElements(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                                                                    org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext context)
        Retrieves matching DOM elements by specified locator and context. Retries several time if the count of elements is zero.

        locateTimer metric will be updated.

        Parameters:
        locator - the locator
        context - the context
        Returns:
        list of DOM elements

        Returns:

      • safely

        @Hidden
protected final SELF safely(Callable<SELF> callable)
        Safely executes specified callable, swallowing all exceptions.

        IMPORTANT:must not be called from step method that is annotated with NestedSteps since this interferes with exception handling.

        Parameters:
        callable - the callable
        Returns:
        StageBase.self()
